details.description: Get guidance on managing your business' payroll, including employees starting and leaving, reporting to HM Revenue & Customs, Income Tax and National Insurance deductions from staff, Statutory Payments
details.body:
Get guidance on managing your payroll, from setting up as new employer to what you need to do at the end of each tax year.

You must use the new Real Time Information system if HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) have told you to.

If HMRC haven’t contacted you, you must keep using the standard PAYE system.

Action Standard PAYE system Real Time Information
Set up your payroll Getting started with PAYE Getting started with PAYE in real time
Day-to-day payroll management Payroll, calculations and form filling Payroll
Employees starting, leaving or changes to pay New employees, employee changes and events Employee starting, Employee changes and events
Calculation and recovery - sick, maternity, paternity and adoption pay Maternity, paternity, adoption, sickness Maternity, paternity, adoption, sickness
PAYE at the end of the tax year End of year tasks: annual return and form filling End of year

For both systems

You can get guidance about:

  • how employers must report employee expenses and benefits
  • specific types of expenses and benefits and how they’re taxed
  • PAYE Settlement Agreements
  • sick pay and leave
  • maternity pay and leave
  • paternity pay and leave
  • adoption pay and leave
